did.abstract: A 1976 letter from Lanier Eason to Kitty and Hank Terjen discussing the author's memories of members of the Roebling family.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Hank and Kitty Terjan, 1976.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Washington Augustus Roebling (May 26, 1837 â€“ July 21, 1926) was an American civil engineer who supervised the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge, designed by his father John A. Roebling. After his wife Emily died in 1903, Roebling remarried Cornelia Witsell Farrow of Charleston, South Carolina in 1908.

The Eason family were neighbors of Cornelia Farrow Roebling and socially connected to the family. For example, Adelaide Ferguson, a "former girlfriend" of Lanier Eason's father, Sidney Lanier Eason, married John Farrow, Cornelia's son. In this letter, Eason shares recollections of the two families and their connections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lanier Eason letter, 1976, 1978.075, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A four-page letter from Lanier Eason to Kitty and Hank Terjen discussing the author's memories of members of the Roebling family, dated 1976. There are pencil notes in some margins clarifying information in the letter, presumably added by the donor.
